tidytable 0.4.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Depcrecated mutate helpers

Source: R/mutate_variants.R
mutate_if..Rd

These helpers have been deprecated. Please use mutate_across.()

mutate_if.(.data, .predicate, .funs, ..., by = NULL)

mutate_at.(.data, .vars, .funs, ..., by = NULL)

mutate_all.(.data, .funs, ..., by = NULL)

dt_mutate_if(.data, .predicate, .funs, ..., by = NULL)

dt_mutate_at(.data, .vars, .funs, ..., by = NULL)

dt_mutate_all(.data, .funs, ..., by = NULL)

Arguments

.data

A data.frame or data.table
.predicate

predicate for mutate_if.() to use
.funs

Functions to pass. Can pass a list of functions.
...

Other arguments for the passed function
by

Columns to group by
.vars

vector c() of bare column names for mutate_at.() to use

Examples

example_dt <- data.table::data.table(
  x = c(1,1,1),
  y = c(2,2,2),
  z = c("a", "a", "b"))

example_dt %>%
  mutate_across.(is.numeric, as.character)
#>        x     y     z
#>    <chr> <chr> <chr>
#> 1:     1     2     a
#> 2:     1     2     a
#> 3:     1     2     b

example_dt %>%
  mutate_across.(c(x, y), ~ .x * 2)
#>        x     y     z
#>    <dbl> <dbl> <chr>
#> 1:     2     4     a
#> 2:     2     4     a
#> 3:     2     4     b

example_dt %>%
  mutate_across.(everything.(), as.character)
#>        x     y     z
#>    <chr> <chr> <chr>
#> 1:     1     2     a
#> 2:     1     2     a
#> 3:     1     2     b

example_dt %>%
  mutate_across.(c(x, y), list(new = ~ .x * 2))
#>        x     y     z x_new y_new
#>    <dbl> <dbl> <chr> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1:     1     2     a     2     4
#> 2:     1     2     a     2     4
#> 3:     1     2     b     2     4
